result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:24 PM
Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Chad Shamali. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br. 4.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court. Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am. Bond continued as previously set. ec

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Garry E. Roberts in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Binger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
